Pre-Game Insights: Ireland will move up two places to No. 2 in the table, while Afghanistan will also climb as many steps to No. 4 if the match gets rained out and the teams share points.
If Ireland win, they will become table toppers albeit for a short while; if Afghanistan win, they will jump up to No. 2.
Post-Match Reflections: Andy Balbirnie, Ireland Captain: Very disappointing. We'd played good cricket and were looking forward to this. Can't do much about the weather.
Mohammad Nabi, Afghanistan Captain: Most of the players are disappointed, not having played on such a fantastic ground.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was abandoned without a ball being bowled due to persistent rain.
The MCG has taken upon itself to put up thrillers on demand, after India - Pakistan, Ireland managed to inch past England via DLS.
There was heavy rain yesterday and is, as Peter Della Penna mentions in the preview, 80% chance from 8 am until 8 pm today.
Others: The grass on the MCG pitch has been retained, so expect assistance for the pacers.
The outfield might not be as quick though.
The MCG has a reserve day for the final.
The match was scheduled to be a 20-over match.
